fields.description:
Hello.

I'm unsure if this is the intended behavior but when you visit a static site URI where there is no page set up, the links on top for Bitbucket, Pricing & Plans, all include the subdomain in the links therefore you just keep circling back to the invalid page.

For example: somethinginvalid.bitbucket.org

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm just trying out the new user page, and sees something strange. There's one repository that I used just for fun, here:

https://bitbucket.org/bertzzie/blog-node

which have 1 follower, myself. But on the user page, it is listed as 4 followers.  The repo page itself list it as only 1 follower. I have attached the image from my user page too. Note that this is also true for another 3 repositories on my list (it has followers on user page, and just 1 on the repo page).

Hope this helps.

fields.description:
As I understand, the unique way to add images to a wiki page is by checking it out and back to bitbucket. This can be a simple task for a developer but not for non-developers. For example: product owners discussing application features can be non-developers.\\
This discourages me to use the wiki at all and I have to use another friendlier wiki service.\\
Adding images to a wiki pages should be as simple as adding images to a bitbucket issue. There should be an "Upload image" or "Upload file" when I edit a wiki page online.
fields.summary: Adding images to wiki is too complex

Something I've been missing, even in the previous layout, is that the newsfeed for a team only seems to include repository creation/deletion events.

It would be much nicer if the Activity tab of a team profile view included all commit/issue/wiki activity on any repos belonging to that team.

Thanks!

fields.description:
As a developer I'd like to be able to add one or more code reviewers from my bitbucket team/organisation and automatically send them an email when they have been added.

This functionality would also help me so I would not have to figure out the bitbucket ID for that user.  Right now our people do not necessarily have bitbucket accounts that reflect our organisation name and we allow people to hook up their personal bitbucket accounts to our bitbucket organisation.  This look up can be a little challenge when trying to use at@ mentions since they do not autocomplete.

Thanks a lot in advance!

Reference:\\
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/116016/bitbucket-add-a-code-reviewer

fields.description:
We use the usual approach of creating wiki page links as follows:

[[Some page]]

This would normally resolve to a link to a page with a name of Some_page.

Recently, our links in the above form now resolve to pages with name Some%20page.

Can you tell me what has changed and how to resolve this? All our wiki links are broken

fields.description: Newer versions of build systems such as [Bamboo|https://atlassian.com/bamboo] and [Jenkins|https://jenkins-ci.org] support being able to build from specific branches. The services on Bitbucket should be able to be filtered to trigger only on pushes involving specific branches/tags.

fields.description:
In the version selector of a single file view in the source browser, you can select to see a file at a specific revision. If you select a revision in the past, then attempt to select the most recent again, you cannot. It no longer appears in the list. to reproduce:

* Select any file in the source browser to view
* Use the revision selector in the upper right and choose any previous revision
* After the view updates, attempt to use the selector to find the current/most recent version. It will not appear in the list.
fields.summary: If you select a previous version of a file, you cannot navigate back to the current version (BB-6964)

When putting in a new spouse of a known person in the DB, system hangs after hitting next on the address screen. So presume unable to navigate to household giving?

It seems that when one puts in a new person in the DB, system hangs after hitting next on address screen.  It seems I can proceed with a transaction only if it is a person in the DB and a match is made.

When hitting back button from Address screen it proceeds forward to the email address screen, not back to the phone screen.\\
When hitting back button from email address, it does not go back to the last screen, it hangs up.\\
When using back button, it really doesn’t seem to work for any screen.

When I revoke a group to create new repositories in my team account they receive the email:

You have received a notification from <name>.

Your membership of the <teamname> team has been revoked
fields.summary: Revoking rights to create repository send wrong email

fields.description:
Given a component of "Some Thing & Another", links to list issues within that component do not get escaped so the url ends up as {{https://bitbucket/foo?component=Some+Thing+&+Another}} - this causes issues where of course the searched component is "Some Thing " as opposed to "Some Thing & Another"

This may also affect Milestones but I haven't checked that out
fields.summary: Issue tracker components, versions, milestones not url encoded in links (BB-7017)

fields.description: Even though there is *still* no way to go directly from a commit to the source from that commit, now the 'Source' tab is completely ruined as well. It is now impossible to list the sources of a previous commit. Instead of the useless 'raw commit' button, which I doubt anyone uses, please create a way to go directly from commit to source AND give us the option back to browse the source from a specific commit. You now have to browse manually to the source and paste the commit id in the url, which is just rubbish. And when you are at it, please also allow that version to be downloaded through zip file or something.
fields.summary: Allow the branch selector in the source browser to accept arbitrary commits (BB-7005)

fields.description:
Bitbucket's Newsfeed is working with the following URL:

https://bitbucket.org/<user>/rss/feed?token=<token>

It would be really nice, to have access to the token, or to have access to something that would return the same information. Currently there is:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/events+Resources

But it's not the same thing, since it's only for one repository at a time. Also I do think the documentation is wrong as it says:

_You can use events to track events that occur on public repositories. Currently, Bitbucket does not support displaying events from private repositories._

Although I am able to return information from private Repositories.
fields.summary: Newsfeed's token in bitbucket (BB-7173)

fields.description: When searching there is a left side panel for ordering the results. Pressing on most of the options leads to a 404 page.
fields.summary: Unable to order search by commits (BB-7022)

fields.description:
One of my repositories, [Passport Tracker Repository|https://bitbucket.org/xtrumanx/passport-tracker], is integrated with AppHarbor via the service integration feature so that each commit let's AppHarbor know there's new code.

However, my last 2 commits caused 2 builds each to start on AppHarbor. It looks like the service sent 2 notifications instead of one.

Can you guys look into it and see what's up? I haven't changed my repository settings since I setup the repository so I don't know what I could have done to cause this.
fields.summary: Service integration posting twice (BB-7752)

fields.description: Finally figured out how to configure username aliases and the commit page now lists the "correct" user for all commits. However the dashboard's recent activity listing still lists the original "incorrect" user.
fields.summary: Dashboard recent activity does not honor username aliases

fields.description:
If the main branch is empty, we should a landing page with welcome text.

However, if you have other branches, there is no menu to view those other branches.

It would be good if we showed the branch selector in this landing page.
fields.summary: If the main branch if a repo is empty the source browser doesn't let you choose another branch (BB-6953)

fields.description:
When I make a pull request, an issue is found with it that I need to fix before it can be merged, and I fix the issue by amending a commit of the pull request (rather than adding another commit on top), then I am unable to update the pull request to include the new commit.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Create repository “prupdate” on Bitbucket
# Populate it:

{code}
 ~$ hg init prupdate
 ~$ cd prupdate
 ~/prupdate$ echo "Hello" > hello.txt
 ~/prupdate$ hg add hello.txt
 ~/prupdate$ hg ci -m "Initial"
 ~/prupdate$ hg push https://cwalther@bitbucket.org/cwalther/prupdate
{code}
# Fork prupdate as “prupdatefork” on Bitbucket
# Create a flawed feature branch:

{code}
 ~/prupdate$ echo "Hello Wold" > hello.txt
 ~/prupdate$ hg branch feature
 ~/prupdate$ hg ci -m "Greet the world"
 ~/prupdate$ hg push --new-branch -r 1 https://cwalther@bitbucket.org/cwalther/prupdatefork
{code}
# Create a pull request asking to merge prupdatefork:feature into prupdate:default
# Fix the typo discovered in the pull request review by creating an amended version of the flawed commit:

{code}
 ~/prupdate$ hg up 0
 ~/prupdate$ echo "Hello World" > hello.txt
 ~/prupdate$ hg branch --force feature
 ~/prupdate$ hg ci -m "Greet the world"
 ~/prupdate$ hg push --force -r 2 https://cwalther@bitbucket.org/cwalther/prupdatefork
{code}
# Strip the replaced revision 1 from Bitbucket
# Attempt to edit the pull request to switch it from the flawed to the fixed revision

*Expected result:*

There should be an “Edit” button on the pull request page.

*Actual result:*

There is no “Edit” button, the pull request cannot be updated.

*Second try:*

1. – 6. as above

7. Do not strip the superseded revision, but leave it on Bitbucket (branch “feature” has two heads now)

8. Push the “Edit” button on the pull request page (which is still there this time, good)

9. Open the source branch popup to attempt to switch from the flawed to the fixed head

*Expected result:*

There should be two entries for the two heads of branch “feature” in the popup.

*Actual result:*

There is only one “feature” entry, and it seems to still refer to the old head, as when I choose it and save the pull request, nothing happens.
fields.summary: Cannot update pull request with replaced commit in hg (BB-7006)

fields.description: File: Users.cshtml Change line:\\ 52. @Html.ActionLink(SiteStrings.Navigation_Delete, "*Delete*", new { id = user.ExistingEmail }, new { @class = "confirm" })\\ into:\\ 52. @Html.ActionLink(SiteStrings.Navigation_Delete, "*DeleteUser*", new { id = user.ExistingEmail }, new { @class = "confirm" })

fields.summary: Team members are getting email notifications when they shouldn't

When viewing the Commits section, single quotes ({{'}}) in a commit message show up as {{'}} instead.

This also occurs in the Recent Activity section, but shows up correctly in the Newsfeed section.

Hi guys,\\
I searched "calendar" in repository, then I refined by language (i.e. Python), and the page tell me that there is 40 repositories. I go at the bottom and select the page 2 but the language condition disappear.\\

fields.description:
i made a comment on issue BCLOUD-3077 but i think it's closed so i'm making another one. the same general error ( ssh access )but different actual error (bad file number ) below is the command executed during clone

{code}
$ git clone git@bitbucket.org:easterneurotours/travelwho.git
Cloning into 'travelwho'...
ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Bad file number
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

and below is the test ssh command suggested in issue BCLOUD-3077

{code}
$ ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa -vvv git@bitbucket.org
OpenSSH_4.6p1, OpenSSL 0.9.8e 23 Feb 2007
debug1: Reading configuration data /c/Users/kimlambiguit/.ssh/config
debug1: Applying options for bitbucket.org
debug2: ssh_connect: needpriv 0
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [207.223.240.181] port 22.
debug1: connect to address 207.223.240.181 port 22: Attempt to connect timed out
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [207.223.240.182] port 22.
debug1: connect to address 207.223.240.182 port 22: Attempt to connect timed out
ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Bad file number
{code}

the public key is added to my account and my firewall is off.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Bad file number error during ssh attempt to bitbucket

fields.description:
I am using TortoiseHG client and today, I am getting SSL unknown protocol errors when trying to pull from Bitbucket to my local disk. This has worked in the past so not sure what has changed.

I also get the same error when using the Mercurial client from the command line. I am running Windows 7.

The command line gives the following error message:\\
abort: error: _ssl.c:504: error:140770FC:SSL routines:SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:unknown protocol
fields.summary: Getting SSL Unknown Protocol error when attempting to pull from bitbucket

Scrollbar just disappears. I've seen this during pull request editing, but haven't checked other components.

My details are:

OSX 10.8.2 64b, Google Chrome 23.0.1271.97

fields.description:
Guys,\\
Im trying to clone my git repo from bitbucket, Your documentation takes me through your example repo url. What the hell is my url ? It should be displayed on my project dashboard prominently so I dont need to go through any documentation, I can directly do "git clone <my-project-url>". You guys can't bury something so important inside pages and pages of documentation
fields.summary: Repo essential details now shown.

fields.description:
I've been using Bitbucket with my students to teach them usage of source control. I was by my self looking for the admin part of the UI (the cogwheel) and looked for several minutes before finding it. I thought it was just me, but several of my students had problem finding it as well and that is why I am reporting it.

I thing that the problem is that for new users it is hard to find since it has a weak contrast, no clear label and that it does not resemble a button unless you happen to hoover you mouse over it.
fields.summary: Admin cog for repository is hard to find (BB-7004)

fields.description:
The {{docinfo}} table is missing from reStructuredText documents rendered as HTML in the source browser. For example, a reStructuredText document like this:

{code}
=====
Title
=====

:Created: 17 December 2012
:Author: Dustin C. Hatch

Section 1
=========

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
{code}

Would be rendered something like this

----
h1. Title
h2. Section 1
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet

----
The "Created" and "Author" information are missing.
fields.summary: Docinfo missing from rendered rST documents (BB-7003)

fields.description:
My use case is that I have some private repositories for closed-source software but I would like to keep users' issues and dev team's issues in one place.

Unfortunately now any permission I grant automatically grants permission to at least read source code.

My suggestion is to add "issues-only" permission.
fields.summary: Create "issues-only" permission (BB-7002)

fields.description:
Hi,

I use Bitbucket to store my project work I do for clients.  I love the service but ever since the site redesign the support for IE7 is awful.  I know, IE7 who uses that?  Well in an enterprise environment as a web developer you need to support the browser that is the number one browser at the company(IE7 in almost every case...).  So every time I want to create a bitbucket project I have to jump through hoops to either install another browser or create the project somewhere else.  I know you can provide better support for IE7 and I wish you would put the extra effort in to provide a few polyfills for the features you feel are necessary.

Thanks!

Jason
fields.summary: Website Issues in IE7

fields.description:
Hi, my team had a Wiki with some info of the project but when today I have gone to see, the most info was disappeared. Is a maintenance task or are there any problem with the system or something like that?

Thanks.

http://code.markhamlin.net/account/user/plover/plans-and-billing/

Note that going to the same URL on bitbucket.org brings me to a valid page, so it's probably a bug due to my custom domain.

(Using this instead works)\\
https://bitbucket.org/account/user/plover/plans-and-billing/
fields.summary: Over plan limit "Resolve this" link does not work over CNAMEs (BB-7000)

fields.description:
For example, look at this commit:

[https://bitbucket.org/mirror/git/commits/a3df180138b85a603656582bde6df757095618cf|https://bitbucket.org/mirror/git/commits/a3df180138b85a603656582bde6df757095618cf]

and compare to the way it's displayed here:

[http://git.kernel.org/?p=git/git.git;a=commit;h=a3df180138b85a603656582bde6df757095618cf|http://git.kernel.org/%3Fp%3Dgit/git.git%3Ba%3Dcommit%3Bh%3Da3df180138b85a603656582bde6df757095618cf]

or here:

[http://github.com/git/git/commit/a3df180138b85a603656582bde6df757095618cf|http://github.com/git/git/commit/a3df180138b85a603656582bde6df757095618cf] (click the "Show Diff Stats" button to see the rename info)

The Bitbucket version shows all the lines of the three renamed files being removed and then added under the new name whereas the kernel.org and GitHub versions only show the diffs for the one file that actually changed.
fields.summary: renames show up as add+remove in Web UI

fields.description: The marked link on the screen in the attachment seems to do nothing.
fields.summary: Send an invitation link in new repository overview doesn't work (BB-6997)

fields.description:
How do I use the issues macro so select issues, that have no milestone or version set?

I'd love to do this:

<<issues ?milestone=xmas12&version= list>>
fields.summary: Issues macro doesn't accept unset query terms (BB-6996)

fields.description:
Some members of our team have problems with pulling from a bitbucket repository.

The result of the 'hg pull' command is:

{code}
pulling from https://bitbucket.org/applicationcraft/JSClient
searching for changes
all local heads known remotely
abort: HTTP Error 400: Bad Request
{code}

Cloning of the entire repository seems to work. But if there were new commits on Bitbucket after that I can't pull.

Pulling from another team member who doesn't have this problem also works.

I didn't investigate thoroughly but if I do 'hg strip' for last 10-20 commits and then pull it works.
fields.summary: 400 Bad Request when trying to pull

fields.description:
Hi,

I would be able to setup the rule in bitbucket which can work as below:\\
When developer push the changes to bitbucket then It could be only possible if Jira issue is linked with commit changeset.\\
Otherwise,\\
developer needs to associate jira issue with commit changesets and then push again.\\
so, Each commit must be associated with jira issue.

Thank You,\\
Dhaval Soni
fields.summary: As an administrator i can configure the Pre-commit hook in bitbucket.

fields.description:
Take a look at this commit:

https://bitbucket.org/Oldrich/journal-2/commits/305196c3c24511062778c1f0fe3b0d1fc3b64245

You will notice that the description of the diff of the commit is in one line. It would be nice (especially for Latex) to allow for word-wrap.

If you click on side-by-side diff then the changed regions get highlighted but it is still in one line only.
fields.summary: Word-wrap in unified diff is missing (BB-6995)

fields.description:
Hello. If the search repository specify the programming language, when using pagination option disappears from the 'language' requesturl.\\
Try:\\
https://bitbucket.org/repo/all/relevance/5?name=server&language=python\\
and use 'Next'.\\
I hope you can understand what I mean. Sorry for my bad english. :)\\
Thx
fields.summary: Remember the language filter when paging repository search results (BB-6994)

fields.description:
When someone reply to the notification emails of the issue tracker, all that we got is this:

Name Surname\\
(Reply via aaa...@someprovider.com):\\
Il 11 dicembre 2012 16:43, Blabla Foobla issues-reply@bitbucket.org ha scritto:

Without the body of the message.\\
Is that a bug or am I missing something?
fields.summary: Email reply on issue tracker is broken (BB-6991)

fields.description: I created a new repository with a new wiki.  The automatically-created home page (Home.md, Markdown, correctly rendered) informs me that the wiki is in Markdown format.  However, when I create a new page with the web interface, it creates a .wiki file in Creole format.  The only way to get Markdown pages seems to be to push from a local clone.
fields.summary: Wiki home page is Markdown, new pages are Creole

fields.description:
Every e-mail validation link I get gives me the 'it expired' message.

Just fyi.

http://click.mailer.atlassian.com/?qs=f6fcc70ece7ad4e93c1ea755ff2140c0682a27d9a53f6003e15afd287737b89764a8a13bd9504443

That was the latest one.
fields.summary: Hi o

fields.description: Is there a way to browse the whole Repo at the state it was a certain time (commit) in history. I used to use this feature in github and it saved me a couple times.
fields.summary: Browse the whole Repo at a point in time (commit)

fields.description: I created a wiki article several days ago, but today the wiki pages says that article does not exist. This is weird, because I can still hg clone the latest wiki repository and read the article.
fields.summary: Missing wiki articles
Can't view commit on an Illustrator file commit.

fields.description: Projects have Downloads section which contains user uploaded files and zip, gz and bz2 compressed archives to all tags and branches in the repo. It would be nice if all those files could be listed via API. Currently correct file names for tags and branches can be guessed with addidional API queries but I can't find any way to list user uploaded files expect when searching those links from HTML source code of Downloads page.
fields.summary: List files in Downloads section via API

fields.description: How about custom 404 pages for the static websites?
fields.summary: Custom 404 Pages

fields.description:
A new status that marks an issue as being tested or has been staged would be greatly helpful to keep track of what has been adressed but not in the master code.

Just resolved is a little more difficult to keep track of what is actually live.
fields.summary: "Staged" or "Testing" status

fields.description: It would be great if you could remove the "nofollow" from paid account profiles. I'm sure everyone would appreciate it. Since it's a paid account, the user has been verified as real.
fields.summary: Don't "nofollow" website URL for paid accounts

fields.description: I would like each issue to be assigned a priority number and then have them sorted in this order...so that I can move issues up and down in order to keep the most critical tasks at the top.  The existing "priority" filters are far too general and essentially useless...resulting in significant loss of productivity either trying to search for the more essential tasks, or because less essential tasks end up getting tackled first.
fields.summary: Feature request: priority ranking (BB-13862)

fields.description:
I'm publishing a small personnal website with your "Publishing a Website" feature. I'd like to publish some PDF documents that can be directly browsed on the website, but I noticed your HTTP server is sending a "Content-Disposition: attachment" header when serving PDF documents, which prevent the user browser from displaying the PDF directly (instead a Save As... popup appears).

I've been told by Atlassian support that this is a bug (see BBS-1414) and to post it here. Can you provide a way to configure my website so that PDF files don't get that HTTP header added to them?
fields.summary: "Content-Disposition" on PDF and SWF files so that they can be viewed in a browser (BB-6986)

fields.description: Have many projects that I'm involved in and Notification box fills up very, very quickly. Need to have the ability to delete all messages and empty it out from time to time. Having to to through page by page to delete messages is horribly inefficient.
fields.summary: Delete ALL Notifications Not just what's on the page (BB-6937)

fields.description: In a repository I've just created, I edited the home page, and the markup did not get rendered at all (it was rendered as plain-text). After cloning the repo, I noticed that the file for the homepage was Home.md not Home.wiki. After renaming and pushing, the markup showed up.
fields.summary: Wiki pages are .md files and they don't render correctly

fields.description: I have committed some changes to my repository ddonthula/zurmozoo but when i tried to create a pull request for the same it showed me notification 'There are no changes'
fields.summary: Pull Request not showing Changes committed in my repo ddonthula/zurmozoo

fields.description:
The POST service is not working for me anymore.\\
Were there any changes in the service today? Or is it simply offline?
fields.summary: POST service not working

fields.description:
I created a team account with my individual company login (jstearns@i1biometrics.com). Then I realized I should have used a team-ish email account for the owner, reserving my individual email account for commits.

So I added a dedicated email account to the email addresses (i1biometrics.bitbucket@gmail.com) and removed jstearns@i1biometrics.com.

Then I wanted to add jstearns@i1biometrics.com to Administrators group for this team account. BitBucket adds the user with an email icon and sends an invitation. I receive the invitation and click the link. The browser goes to the URL and prints the error:

"You have been invited to join a team\\
i1 Biometrics wants you to join the i1 Biometrics team\\
You are already a member of this group."

Repeated resends of invitation result in the same error. BitBucket thinks an email invitation is required, but responses to the invitation are rejected as unnecessary.

How do I add an email account to a group of a team account after that email account has been a team account owner?

Thanks,

Jim Stearns\\
i1 Biometrics\\
Seattle
fields.summary: Can't add former Team Owner to Group: "You are already a member of this group"

fields.description: Since the introduction of the "Feature Branches" view, the commit history page no longer shows the list of heads in the default branch, at least for Mercurial. This was a great feature when used with Mercurial's lightweight branching, as it allowed one to quickly see the various branches that haven't been merged in, even those without a name.
fields.summary: Show anonymous heads as feature branches in Feature Branches tab (BB-6939)

fields.description:
The Download button in the repository main page doesn't link to the file anymore.

It is a major issue for us.

Thx.

Flavien Hello
fields.summary: Download button doesn't work anymore

fields.description:
I have been trying to convince members of my group in my uni to switch to bitbucket. The major use we have is to store partial papers that we are working on. We generally write the paper in tex, But I discovered recently that I can convert the tex to markdown with pandoc, save that instead, and have bitbucket display the markdown. However, the markdown syntax support by bitbucket is a subset of elements provided by pandoc. The most urgent feature is the ability to recognize citations in [@cite] syntax.\\
If we could get the markdown to expand to pandoc feature set, I can provide our group with a more convincing story to switch.
fields.summary: markdown support (pandoc)

fields.description: It would be EXTREMELY helpful if there was a way to order by, or at least see the last time an issue was commented on in the issue tracker's list view.
fields.summary: Commenting on an issue should update the last updated time for it (BB-6935)

fields.description:
Currently side-by-side diff can be viewed in a modal window, 1 changed file at a time.

It would be nice to have that as a first class diff view, like current unified one. I mean in the main window with all the files viewed in side-by-side fashion.

Additionally pretty useful would be if side-by-side diff could be set as a default for viewing changeset changes. So one wouldn't need to click some button all the time.
fields.summary: Side-by-side diff as a first class citizen
